document.title: Physical Education Standards of Learning for Virginia Public Schools

38B4EA6DEB3D44559C3BDDECB8B35E0E.description: Identify and describe legal considerations of working as a personal fitness instructor.

A76995F92D3C4F7E942683FE6FB25EDE.description: Identify and describe appropriate facility supervision to maintain safety of users.

FDCE2C084CC54357949396D597297972.description:
Explain and describe appropriate inspection and care of equipment to maintain safety and
maximize use.

69C408A0868D444387099FAE56394549.description: Identify and describe necessary facility maintenance.

DFA61B580C644288A0B54BD7C4BDF53D.description: Identify and describe the professional responsibilities of a personal fitness instructor.

F9F9F76C6FE2444A861BCC980DB22004.description:
Identify and explain the role, scope of practice, and code of ethics of a personal fitness
instructor.

0A99070C71CF4CF6A39F091CE91A193C.description:
Identify and explain requirements to become a certified personal fitness instructor and maintain
certification, including certification requirements, requirements to maintain certification, and
resources for professional development to increase knowledge and skill and maintain
certification.

CEBF093509D74A25A74F029D060CF2FA.description:
The student will identify and explain professional and legal responsibilities to manage a
personal business and be employed as a personal fitness instructor.

4A42A2911A254A0CB854BB744DBAD97C.description: Identify and explain eating disorders including anorexia nervosa and bulimia nervosa.

27964443B2744DFA9EF05E33A23DEFAE.description: Identify and explain inappropriate weight-loss methods.

CB70AB4BF4C441F88ED92A447F54CFE6.description: Explain influences on body composition, including diet, exercise, and behavior modification.

C76A11D24A2B46289F6D97B0E7DF9EA8.description:
Define terms related to body composition, including body mass index (BMI), lean body mass,
and fat mass.

D69066BD4F3B449D9F74E6450DC242C7.description: Explain the relationship between body composition and health.

828DDCBEFEFF4D43AFC2DF4B4380F805.description:
Explain potential risks, benefits, and contraindications associated with use of supplements and
ergogenic aids.

79798678FD014535A3D36EC14E6E1D42.description:
Identify and describe common supplements and ergogenic aids used by individuals in training
programs.

5050E27DA85940C39509B884F591E3EE.description:
Explain how to maintain hydration in a physically active individual, including effective
methods to rehydrate after exercise.

CC7DB54E153B4CB1B91B212A3C28836C.description: Explain the influences of nutrition and physical activity on lipid and lipoprotein profiles.

E53CDEE1AFAD40EE860F3DC8DBD4AB9F.description: Explain energy balance and relationship to weight gain, weight loss, or weight maintenance

6968297D4C474FFDB45EDDDABEAB8856.description: Identify the number of kilocalories found in macronutrients that provide energy.

3CD9E978620A4C7EB29F7882ED44BA0E.description: Identify macronutrients used by the body for energy.

C137F81449844573B9FAABE0D0ACD95B.description: Identify and explain dietary guidelines based on USDA recommendations.

5545B46B901C4A1B871398A38DBD4492.description: The student will explain energy balance.

D992FC660FE042199E51096534DCC8F5.description:
Identify and describe universal precautions and personal protection used during CPR and first
aid.

F634F6B5EA3B4E648171D455BAB833F1.description: Demonstrate first-aid techniques used in emergency situations.

5013D3726E6642139CAC9A36F09E7001.description: Identify emergency situations requiring first aid.

CDF7B7B0DFE14CBBA04E2F95C4D59A0C.description: Demonstrate CPR and AED procedures for adults and children.

ECE76FB68C564B10AA8E78D1A219E84E.description: Demonstrate and explain how to respond in an emergency situation.

BB87723AA0994A989F39B44B0E7B404B.description: Demonstrate effective and varied teaching techniques for a variety of exercises.

696F9C7FE4F041A2A8512A3C5BF318C6.description: Explain learning styles and instructional strategies, including visual, auditory, and kinesthetic.

A6A9525DF9074B82BD7408B15B4DEFA5.description:
Demonstrate effective teaching techniques for working with individuals of different learning
styles, motivation levels, and physical activity levels.

B31526AAF3344AB98EA1EB7BAE37B1F5.description:
Define and explain cultural competence and its importance in developing rapport with another
individual.

5BFAF497C54F458FBCCE19BB57C553D0.description:
The student will accept responsibility for taking a leadership role as well as demonstrate
the ability to follow, in order to accomplish group goals.

E2E5272BF05E4113816C2ADB01B25FF0.description: Identify indications for use of mind-body exercise.

A726106C4AE1421F81CE86FEC1E5C574.description: Describe different forms of mind-body exercise (e.g., yoga, Pilates, tai chi).

B94796EA20404DE68EFA3098470F77E1.description: Identify contraindications of range of motion exercises.

DE8F5B7880E0407686498378CD76C5AF.description:
Define and explain exercises to improve range of motion, including dynamic stretching, passive
stretching, proprioceptive neuromuscular facilitation (PNF), and partner stretching.

28503BDF6AB5411DB4F7F550E52D8CE4.description: Evaluate fitness programming for others to determine effectiveness.

B3F74122881B4FD5BD04EBC6EC9E4A92.description: Develop a cardiorespiratory training program with appropriate progressions.

BCCB0C72265E4E6B993ECA6D8C8C0D81.description: Develop a resistance-training program with appropriate progressions.

7A62FF172FDC42FDB93AF05B13ACBAFB.description: Develop functional programming for stability, mobility, and movement.

08241DB852294C8AAA5BD8FDC5E9A97E.description:
Apply the FITT (frequency, intensity, time, and type of exercise) principles to improve or
maintain cardiovascular and musculoskeletal fitness in healthy adults, seniors, youth,
adolescents, and pregnant women.

58AEAD96CF8E479DB5CFC4EA2701362B.description:
Develop SMART fitness goals with another individual based on fitness assessments and
personal desired outcomes.

07B415FCFD5E47AF982E1745335898B7.description: Conduct a health and exercise history with another individual.

0DF4D0CF1FAB4B4AA6B617A8195AB22D.description: Identify the common signs and symptoms of cardiovascular, metabolic, or pulmonary diseases.

CBE4104447AF4BC9B53A1948700738CE.description: Identify the limitations of a health/medical history.

3FD108BFEC3E4A57987A766C5556D983.description: Identify the components of a health/medical history.

5A59C16C60EA46AB9EB94C364E3B056E.description:
The student will plan and describe a personalized fitness and conditioning program for
others that includes skill-related and health-related fitness components to achieve and
maintain a health-enhancing level of physical fitness for a lifetime.

1969E0106C864A4C8CDA5D6B11E97280.description: Identify and explain exercise modifications appropriate when participant is injured.

A00170587D074885BD25F4E2D078A2F9.description: Explain inflammatory response and the healing process.

9E150B0D7A29488582C2F3165A1E999F.description:
Compare and contrast muscle fatigue and delayed onset muscle soreness (DOMS) with
musculoskeletal injury/overuse.

FC43DEE1C61D45C2AC96168AE7E1E3A4.description: Explain reversibility or deconditioning and the effect on fitness and performance.

9020CC3812E741C6A0312A03BD62E8C5.description:
Explain blood-pressure response related to acute exercise, chronic exercise, and changes in
posture.

C219C963C74A415B8A0C00AC1D3A8B96.description: Explain the body’s response to warm-up and cool-down.

71D5EA50DFC64C4CA141C3680C29C42A.description: Explain the body’s response to resistance training.

817DC437768A48088C03E2CB82DF63F6.description: Explain the body’s response to cardiorespiratory exercise.

84DFD8C9981D491D837A74D06BE56F6C.description: Explain the effects of acute and chronic exercise on aerobic and anaerobic energy systems.

87D37F7026664D3D889E01B81FEF8AC4.description:
Differentiate between recommendations for physical activity and training principles to meet
goals for general health benefits, weight management, fitness improvements, and athletic
performance enhancement.

A7F7A81B13A6451A96C86EB34EADE015.description: Explain the benefits and challenges of different methods for determining body composition.

39885A20CEEF461CBA8F01FCD03A88B9.description: Identify and explain different methods for determining body composition.

21B4BB9542C14B53A9A40D1F7805A18C.description: Identify contraindications to health-related and skill-related fitness assessments.

14B70F0947FF489FBFAA3471A3EF1084.description: Perform assessments to evaluate the skill-related components of fitness.

33C28333A52A4141BF33D13E2C6AA6C7.description: Perform assessments to evaluate the health-related components of fitness.

2D312B9F2CFF49678C019DB025322B22.description: Identify contraindications to assessments of movement.

A3339F236C694AA986B04EE8D02860DA.description: Perform and analyze balance and core-strength evaluations of another individual.

6246058059734211A4C7368E1E0E3718.description: Perform and analyze flexibility evaluation of another individual.

DE1683EEDAAF450FBA9AEC8CC5938B78.description:
Perform and analyze movement evaluation for stability and mobility of the joints of another
individual.

70EF3859780A43B58D89BFB3257BC083.description: Perform and analyze postural evaluation of another individual.

9A6F3F0CB2B44492AE6ABD285CF19943.description: Identify and explain curvatures of the spine.

6DF6BFDF521547ADA97C61CE9B8067FE.description:
Explain how muscles contract, including agonist and antagonist movements in relation to
muscle contraction.

0A8D0113E3D8474397EBE742CDBE98C3.description: Explain movements that result based on muscle origin and insertion.

C662AF58C77647F89776D6B8C6A641B3.description:
Explain muscle structure and function, including major muscles of the body, terms related to
muscles, and muscle origins and insertions.

1C856FF9245341F5AF5D93B25EE4C9FD.description: Identify and describe the types of joints, including hinge and multiaxial (ball and socket).

90F716FDF56942808D593F7BFD597621.description: Identify the major bones of the skeletal system.

F8CB174254854AEBA6AEC7FFC8298483.description:
Identify the planes of motion and types of movement that occur in the frontal, sagittal, and
transverse planes.

2A4D1E7044F343C287FDB92A582EEA1F.description:
The student will apply knowledge of anatomy and movement principles and concepts to
skill performance in strength training, conditioning, and fitness activities.

EE1060F582B5439D96D7F32C90A58BEA.description: Identify and explain considerations for special populations.

134F9C9B611F4DB99771E5295C06DBAE.description:
Explain the role of the personal trainer in promoting an individual’s adherence to an exercise
program.

646C569A382D421180333E666BB7BCEF.description: Identify and apply strategies to increase adherence in an exercise program.

54DA7DEF3B6449A498670F51BD52CAE8.description: Describe psychological factors that may influence a person’s adherence to an exercise program.

B202139367CC44688D785723C07233C5.description: Explain principles that result in behavior change.

49C017D526FF4C5D9C6D192A8BA13048.description:
Identify and describe factors that influence participation in physical activity and adherence to
an exercise program.

1D4C1786AC544D4DBE36853E5711C84D.description: Identify contraindications to advanced resistance-training techniques.

68740268A1FA49B0B969A1E7834C5009.description:
Demonstrate safety protocols and procedures for strength-training, physical conditioning, and
fitness activities.

3EE9C4A3CF75419AB7F37D3D36205E25.description:
Demonstrate the proper use of fitness equipment, selectorized weight machines, and free
weights.

0FD48DBDA1614888916E9AFF0BD02FC0.description:
Demonstrate correct and safe techniques and form when performing strength-training, physical
conditioning, and fitness activities and exercises.

DE49575AED8F42F2819877C5218BDDBA.description: Apply principles of exercise progression to improve fitness.

376F3AAB1B3D428BB22E85CF1C939614.description: Identify and describe advanced resistance-training techniques.

6E57B927AE764164B210D9CC001A9A11.description: Apply movement skills and patterns to functional fitness activities that support ADL.

04518D125F484ED09434CA75F7536BEC.description: Define and identify activities of daily living (ADL) as the tasks of everyday life.

B4C8E0A1B587445482BB8D02FC53D2B7.description:
Describe and demonstrate activities specific to improving the skill-related components of
fitness.

B0F598B8011749C7B63AA3DFDD548AA0.description: Analyze movement activities for component skills and movement patterns.

EC895C4A913C4808AC8FD791C7049759.description:
Demonstrate correct movement skills and patterns for strength-training, physical conditioning,
and fitness activities.

DF84C6BE38DD46D2B26A0CD3CA8ADAF8.description:
The student will demonstrate mastery of the movement skills and patterns used to perform
a variety of strength-training, conditioning, and fitness activities.
